thread.title: Shelter Dog Can’t Stop Grinning After Being Rescued
thread.title_full: Shelter Dog Can’t Stop Grinning After Being Rescued

author: Barry K
title: Shelter Dog Can’t Stop Grinning After Being Rescued
text:
Shelter Dog Can’t Stop Grinning After Being Rescued In today’s feel-good news By Alisa Hrustic March 7, 2017 Cindy Renner/I Have A Dream Rescue Organization Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
A timid shelter dog named Smokey has been searching for a new home since Valentine’s Day. He’s been sitting in Ohio’s Franklin County Dog Shelter & Adoption Center with a stuffed gray elephant toy, which was left with him when his original owners dropped him off, according to The Dodo . He got so attached to the toy, that a sign hung on his kennel read the dog and toy must leave together. 
Smokey was scared in the shelter, so much so that the staff noticed he had started growling in his kennel. They knew he needed a different environment, so they put out word that he needed a foster home. Advertisement 
Privacy Policy | About Us 
Luckily, two volunteers from the I Have a Dream Rescue Organization, noticed Smokey and his toy while visiting the shelter—and they instantly felt the need to help him. While the pup was to be euthanized in early March, he now can’t help but grin, because the group is in the process of weeding through foster home offers. Since the original owners only gave him up because they lost their home, he will be offered back to his family first. If not, he’ll finally be leaving the shelter regardless. 
The organization hopes Smokey’s popularity will encourage people to adopt from shelters. Hoping to invest in a new best friend? Here’s what you should know before getting a dog .
